comments.commentBody: Israel relied on the US for spare parts. Israel was a front for the US to play both sides in the Iran/Iraq War. Those were US parts going to Iran.

What is the difference?
If someone says that he will not touch you because you are Jewish, do you think you will not be offended and just "respect"? Do you really think some who refuses to shake other person for his "belief" genuinely respect that other person except handshaking part? Like, women to the Orthodox Jewish men in general? Can you imagine someone dare to say that to African American in this country?
A discrimination is a discrimination. Simple and clean.

I don't understand, but can sympathize with the man's religious views, however it should be up to him to find the solution.  The offense is when he wants her to accommodate him. If a woman wants to be generous and change seats good on her; but it is not, and should not be made, her responsibility to do so.
If I boarded and saw I was to sit next to a Hasid, I'd demand another seat.  Oh.  I'd probably be arrested.
It seems to me a way to assert dominance as a male over a female. Hence I wouldn't likely move if asked.
Right on !!

Don't fly a commercial airline if you don't want contact or a seat next to a woman. I do not have to honor your requests to move from my seat just because you have a religious belief. If you consider it an "insult" to your religion, that is your choice.
Mark Thomason: "Iran is not the problem here."  Please state the facts upon which you make that claim.  As far as I am concerned, Iran is definitely supporting the Houthis with money and materiels.
Iran never does anything directly, they do it by proxies, Hezbollah and hamas are tow good examples.  So the fact that they are not directly bombing means nothing.

And just how do you know how much money do Iranians have? Despite the sanctions, Iran's economy has been growing fast - which is the reason it is so emboldened in nuclear negotiations. Only the US and some Western countries sanction Iran; China - the largest consumer of oil, is Iran's largest customer. So yes, Iran does have money, and it is heavily using them to fund Houthis, as well as Hamas and Hezbollah and al-Assad.

Re: Sunni/Shiite schism in this, the two largest Sunni powers are Turkey and Pakistan, and both met in the last few days with Iran to call for an end to this fighting.

The Saudis are bombing, but Iran isn't. The Saudis are sending troops, but Iran isn't. The Saudis are sending money, but Iran doesn't even have money on anything like that scale after long sanctions. The US is providing the bombs and other ammo for all this, and Iran is providing next to nothing, in a place already awash with the rifles and such that it has to offer.

Iran is not the problem here.

I recently experienced a slightly skewed version of this scenario.  Last month on a flight from Warsaw to NYC, a Hasidic gentleman sat between me and another woman.  Before he fell asleep we chatted (I was surprised he was so friendly to me, a woman!) and he told me he hadn't slept in two days.  Then for the next 8 hours, he was passed out so deeply, his body ended up draped over all three seats.  As much as we tried to nudge him and outright move him, he never woke up and my seatmate and I had as much contact with him as one can have without blushing.  It was quite hilarious, and also sort of gratifying to me to think that sometimes matters of the body trump all these silly religious fetishes we make up.

Actually,under Jewish Law, “Derech Eretz Kadman Le’Torah”-“The laws of the land-civility,decency,respectfulness,politeness supersede the Torah.”,not the other way
around,as you suggest.
These men are violating Jewish Law by behaving this way.
Added a bit of feta, I thought it rounded out the salad nicely.

it is neither misogyny or  religious observance. the jewish religion does not require this kind of separation between the sexes.it is custom which changes over time. one person in an earlier post had it right. there is a race to prove who is more frum or religious or to show more piety than other orthodox people. if you want to live that way fine but not off my back.

Joseph's comment that men who seek to sit beside women for the "physical contact" are worse than men who, for religious reasons, request to avoid female contact, describes the other side of the same coin. Both actions are disrespectful to the women who are put on the spot, aren't they?
Hey - if someone wants to give me their donated miles so that I can sit in business class instead of in the galley - I'll find a "religious conviction" too.  :-)

"such requests"? Do you think you can ask the airline to put you not next to black/asian/homosexual/transgender/kid or what so ever? Why airline company should take such a discriminative action? Also in many case, they cannot see if the seat owner is man or woman? Are you sure you can tell the person's gender 100% by their names in real life?

This is obviously sexual discrimination issue and "request" to handle it itself is discriminative. Do you have guts to request not to sit next to African American for ANY reason? No excuse.

I really don't think this is about sexual discrimination or hate. The airlines should do their best to accommodate such requests. If the flight is sold out then communicate to the traveler when the next flight will be available to full fill that request and let the traveler make his own choice. Business class seating is the obvious solution. I am sure equally religious people or some charity can get people to donate their miles for some pool to address the cost issue.

Looking at the financial benefits to government from marijuana legalization simply through the taxes generated and disregarding the savings from incarceration, law enforcement and other social costs is something someone who is completely stoned and obsessed with looking at their hands would do.
They problem is that they do not feel that they are the ones who need to change seats. In your scenario, he would expect that the woman in business class ride coach.

@Dr. MB: "How does it matter if we just accommodate to such a request?" Wow, ever heard of having to sit in the back of the bus?

A man who "can't" sit next to a woman and expects the WOMAN to accommodate him is wrong on every level.
It's not so much overturning HL; it's overturning the misguided law that it interpreted.

The NW gave me the hardest time, also, mainly because I started out with 1A ALIGHT which seemed SOO right for [Get down], and fit nicely with Johnny B GOODE. Not til ALIT LIT up did I doubt it.

Tougher than yesterday's, me too, but have to love the tie-in to my Horatio ALGER HISS Folder.

My NW filled in really quickly -- I had ACRONYM immediately, which gave me OCALA, ORBIT, & GOODE, and once I had them, BASSO, SABOTEUR, etc etc filled right in. So BOOGIE came last, but it was pretty clear what it had to be.

I was thinking of this as a reward for persevering with Thursday's puzzle. Definitely horses for courses! (Or courses for horses??)

I guess it's horses for courses. I found this puzzle much harder than yesterday's lively rebus entry. To finish it I had to correct nine squares via Mlle Check and, what's much worse, I had to *Reveal* four squares—I almost never use reveal. The bottom half filled in nicely for me, but the top half, and especially the NW, was terra incognita. Glad that's over.

I'm so glad you find this trivial and amusing.

Their behavior is offensive to everyone, especially women, and must be condemned.

It is not just seating.

It is their entire sense of entitlement about Everything that is so offensive.
I think you think you're kidding, but you're absolutely right about suing.

Mr. Krugman:
If economists study economics and business men study business and bankers study banking how is it that all of them are experts on the economy?That may be why some pretty simple definitions get to be so complicated. This may be evidence of self-interest, Seems that way to me.

If some of these "experts" were to start making loans to real people and real assets instead of making themselves rich on paper profits; I have a feeling Mr. Bernanke's stance on raising interest rates might change.

if these men are so incapable of controlling their behavior, perhaps they should either arrange for a separate flight specifically for them; or request a section of the plane (at the back) be reserved for their group.

I took the test, and I understand why the questions were phrased the way they were.  I thought it made sense, and I scored where I expected-- semi-owl. I live next door to a couple that are both extreme larks and it constantly amuses us how our paths do and don't cross.  For example, I stay late at work due to feeling productive and inspired late in the day.  When I get home around 9, ready for a few hours of relaxation, their house is totally dark and they are in bed.  I avoid using the porch light for this reason because it shines in their bedroom window.   And by the same token, they are returning from errands on a Saturday morning, having worked out and bought all their groceries already when I am making my first cappuccino and scowling at the bright, bright sun.  It's fascinating how we are hard-wired in such different ways.

Isn't that one of Fact Boy's peeves? Beano prevents gas when eating beans and Gas-X absorbs gas that didn't get prevented. Apparently crepitation experts consider these very different genres.

We're meeting some Seattle relatives in San Francisco tomorrow. Spring break brings the first wave. They saw the Ai Weiwei show on The Rock today, so we're off to the de Young in the morning.
